availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, attorney. South Carolina native. Son of Alexander Hays and Nancy Gilbert Hays. Married to Nancy Hays. Father of Susan Hays, Elizabeth Hays, America Hays, Martha Hays, Mary Hays, James Hays, Franklin Hays, Richardson Hays, Nancy Hays, and William Hays. Married to Sarah V. Hays. Father of Ann Hays. Resident of Knox County, Kentucky, in 1830. Resident of Knox County in 1840. Farmer in Laurel County in 1850. Attorney in Jackson County in 1860. Served as a captain in the United States Army and provost marshal for Kentucky's 8th Congressional District from 1863 to 1865.
